review_blob: Very nice summer beer; not too heavy, not too light.  Slight German Weiss beer flavor, but only slight.  Still a transparent light color, but with more body than a pilsner.  Nice with a lemon wedge.
One of my favorite beers.  Very hoppy, yet not overpoweringly bitter.  Try with green grapes.  It tends to enhance the already fruity nose of the beer.

Basically agreed with the last reviewer; very nice nose, full of sweet spices, ginger, cloves, cinnamon, but rather lacking on flavor.  Practically no hops, and no aftertaste.  I remember thinking the taste to be rather transparent; excellent aroma, but none of that aroma transfers into the flavor of the beer.  Its rather light and easy drinking, but the pumpking flavor doesnt come through as well as does say the Wild Onion Pumpkin Ale (still my fave pumpkin ale).
beer_name: Buffalo Bills Americas Original Pumpkin Ale

review_blob: This is a great American Pale Ale, brewed by the St. Louis Brewery (brewhouse beer brewed in St. Louis, and bottled beer brewed in Minnesota).  Very nice hoppy flavor, but not overwhelmingly bitter.  Im quite partial to hoppy beers, and while this beer is definitely not as hoppy as say the Three Floyds Alpha King or something of the like, I still really like its cleaner finish.  This is a somewhat lighter beer that can be enjoyed on hot days without feeling too heavy.

I couldnt believe some of the reviews on this beer; its one of my favorite porters!  Although after reading, I thought about their points a bit more.  I do agree, the vanilla/chocolate tones may be overpowering a bit, but I actually like that.  Its a little sweet, very robust in flavor, and smooth drinking.  It is maybe a little watery in comparison to other similar porters/stouts like the Aspen Meadow Vanilla Cream Stout (very thick, but not as tasteful imo), but the taste of this beer more than makes up for that.  Its definitely one of the beers I look forward to drinking when the weather turns colder.

The name sounds amazingly tantalizing, but the beer just doesnt quite seem to live up to it imo.  Its still a really good stout porter style beer, just not quite as much flavor and aroma as the name suggests.  Very nice thick creamy stout, though.
